title: Edit a subscription record
content:
You can edit multiple records simultaneously by selecting them in the grid and updating them in the Preview pane on the right. For more information, see Mass update.

Editing cloud subscriptions in the agent interface isn't supported in this release.

To edit a subscription record, perform the following steps:

  1. From the main menu, select Build >Service Asset & Configuration.

  2. From SACM Home, select Subscriptions.

  3. Select the subscription record. Click the record identifier in the Id column to display the selected record.

  4. By default, the subscription record is displayed with the General tab selected. Click the tab you want to edit or view:

    Tab Description
    General Displays details of the selected record. For more information, see the General tab section.
    Workflow

    Displays the workflow for the subscription. To change the status to inactive, you must have the appropriate rights.
    Related records Displays requests that initiated or updated the subscription. For more information, see the Related records tab section.
    Finance Displays the expense lines generated or created for the subscription if the Expense lines capability is enabled in Application settings.
    Discussions

    Displays any relevant conversations about the current record. For more information about discussions, see Discussions.

    The Discussions tab here only displays the comments/discussions posted from the Agent interface.

    When a user adds a comment/feedback on a subscription from Service Portal:

    - If Service Definition is defined in the subscription, the comment added by Service Portal user will be saved to the Service Definition field.

    - If there's no Service Definition defined in the subscription, the comment will be saved to Asset model of the CI in the subscription.

    - If there's no Service Definition defined in the subscription and no Asset model defined in the CI, the comment will be saved to the CI which is connected to the subscription.

    - The comment posted from Service Portal will never be saved to the subscription itself in the Agent interface.
    History Displays changes to the selected record. For more information about history, see History.

  5. Save your changes.

General tab

Subscription details

Field Description
Display label This field is automatically populated when the Subscribed service part of the dialog box is completed.
Description

The description of the subscription.

Note: This field is only available for the tenants created in 2021.05 or later versions.
Start date The date and time when the subscription is to start.
End date The date and time the subscription is to end.
Subscriber The user who is to be the subscriber.
Subscriber group The group that's to be the subscriber. If there is a subscriber, this field may be left blank.
Subscription status The status of the subscription.
  • Enable group access to subscription
    • Full access
    • Operate subscription
    • Modify subscription
    • Cancel subscription

The Enable group access to subscription field and its sub-fields are only displayed for cloud subscriptions.

Note:  Don't change the values of the fields here, because we don’t support agent users to enable/disable group access or assign/update a subscription group in cloud subscriptions.

Enable group access to subscription:

  • Off - Only the subscriber has full access (operate, modify and cancel) to the cloud subscription.
  • On - The cloud subscription can be accessed by the subscriber and the users in the configured groups.
    • Full access - All users in the groups are granted with rights to operate, modify and cancel this subscription. 
    • Operate subscription - All users in the groups are granted with rights to operate this subscription. 
    • Modify subscription - All users in the groups are granted with rights to modify this subscription. 
    • Cancel subscription - All users in the groups are granted with rights to cancel this subscription. 

Subscribed service

A subscription includes only one of Subscribed to service, Subscribed to device, Subscribed to infrastructure, or Subscribed to enterprise asset.

Field Description
Based on service

The subscription is based on a service definition. This comes from either the service definition where the initiated offering is, or from the service definition containing the subscribed actual service.

For example, assume the following: there is a service definition Mobile Phones. Under this service, there is an offering: Order New Mobile Subscription. If a user requests that offering, fulfilling the request creates a subscription. The subscription is based on the Mobile Phones service definition, so the value of this field is Mobile Phones.
Service The actual service, as defined in Service Asset and Configuration Management, in the subscription.
Device The device in the subscription.
Infrastructure and peripheral The infrastructure and peripheral assets in the subscription.
Enterprise asset The enterprise asset in the subscription.

Chargeback

Field Description
Initial charge The basic, minimum, upfront price of the subscription.
Recurring charge This is the extra amount charged for the subscription, every time specified in the recurring period field.
Currency The currency used for the costs.
Recurring period If applicable, this is how often the recurring price is charged for the subscription.

Related records tab

Section Description
Initiated by request The request initiating the subscription.
Updated by request

This section displays a list of requests updating the subscription.
